website_summaries.verdict: The initial cost may seem steep, but you won't need to buy (or wash) a single changing pad cover. Easily the best changing pad on the market.
pros: Soft and comfortable, yet completely water-resistant
Solid surface allows for effortless cleaning and doesn’t absorb fluids like most others do, drastically reducing the risk of bacterial growth
Durable enough to be passed on to younger siblings
cons: Although soft, the surface can feel cool on bare skin

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my new Keekaroo Peanut Changer with my newborn for about 2 weeks, and it already has a stain on it. I've tried diaper wipes, gentle dish detergent, plain water, and a cleaning spray, but cannot get the stain out. I've contacted customer service who told me "that the stain is only a surface stain." Fortunately the customer service for Keekaroo is great and they are sending me a replacement product.
customer_reviews.author: E H

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper changer ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper changer ever. It is expensive at around a hundred dollars, but if you think about it, a regular diaper changer is about $20, and you then buy 4 sets of covers for it because poop will get on the cover and you'll have to wash the covers, and you're looking at about a hundred dollars and a lot of extra work. Just get this one. The only down side is poop will stain the foam. I've been using this for just a month and the foam is already stained yellow where my baby's butt lies.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Baby does seem to not like how it is cold on her back during diaper ...
customer_reviews.text: I went a few months with baby before deciding to order this. What was the kicker? Baby started rolling, and rolling, and rolling. Especially during diaper changes. The Keekaroo helps keep her contained so I don't have to worry about her rolling off the changing table. It is bigger than I imagined, but I know she will growth with it. It is a breeze to clean too - just wipes clean. Baby does seem to not like how it is cold on her back during diaper changes, so I lay a little cloth under her back as a little barrier.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy the Pup

customer_reviews.title: Stains Easily
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this because we thought it would be easy to clean in case the baby had a blowout while we were changing her. We are first time parenta and thought this was highly unlikely that it would happen, but boy were we wrong. Well, our baby is 5 months old, she has had multiple blowouts on the changing pad and unfortunately, as you can see from photos, the changing pod is stained. I paid a lot of money for something that did not live up to my expectations. We didn’t religiously use the changing pad liners. If you buy this changing pads, use the liners every single change!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Tillson

customer_reviews.title: Do not put on a white dresser! It will ruin it!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product until I took it off my white dresser. It left a yellowish mark the shape of the changer. I’ve tried everything to get it off but it will not come off! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Stain
customer_reviews.text: Like some of the other reviews have said, staining occurs fairly easily. After opening up my daughter's diaper before she was finished around her fifth day of life I was able to test the "easy to clean" claim on the product description. While the changer is easy to wipe down, I noticed a bit of staining right away that wouldn't come out even with significant scrubbing. I still think I prefer this changer to any traditional changing pad though. The number of liquid accidents that have occurred and have been easily cleaned up more than make up for the staining, but I think it's unfortunate that the changer will slowly start looking dirty over time if more colorful accidents occur.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, hygenic changing pad
customer_reviews.text: My 1 month old LOVES her changing table. Big smiles when we change her, and it’s our go to spot to put her when she falls asleep feeding, and we want to gently wake her up. One note: it’s cold to the skin in winter, especially for little babies! We bought a box of 200 puppy pee pads/ hospital pee pads and use one as a soft cotton liner. Makes it warmer for her soft baby skin.
customer_reviews.author: Oph

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing to say the least
customer_reviews.text: We bought this changing pad obviously because we wanted to save money on changing pad covers and have an easy to clean changing pad for our new born. We’ve now had it two months and it is stained with our newborns accidents. We have tried EVERYTHING to get this stain out and nothing has worked. I have attached a picture so you can see it. It seems like a worthy investment but now that time has gone by I don’t think it fully fits the description it’s given. We are really disappointed and feel like we wasted our money. Two stars for the fact it hasn’t ripped and we like the look of it and color.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Charboneau

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This changing pad is amazing! It might not be as cute as a typical pad that you can cover with patterned sheets, but it is very functional. Pros - easy to clean, material prevents it from slipping or moving while on a dresser (we turned our dryer into a changing station), large enough that it’ll last for awhile Cons - not as cute as a normal changing pad but it’s not ugly, material can get cold which might be uncomfortable for an infant (I use a munchkins waterproof liner)
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Baby Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We recently welcomed home our first baby guirl and I've been splurging a little on baby things. After doing a ton of research, I decided to pull the trigger on this thing and, to be honest, it's my favorite baby purchase. It's soft and easy to clean and just a joy to use. My wife nearly killed me when she saw how much I paid for it but it's easily my favorite baby purchase and I use it several times every day.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Nice but you can find cheaper alternatives
customer_reviews.text: Dont get me wrong, this thing does exactly what it claims. It is easy to clean and durable. However I really wish I would have done more research before buying. Bumbo makes a changing pad that is very similar, pretty much the same material, or at least something they cleans up just like this. The difference is price. The Bumbo changing pad i bought was half the price of this, still expensive for a changing pad but better then welp over $100. Like i said this pad is nice, but there are cheaper alternatives that do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: ALfromTX

customer_reviews.title: Watch out left/right handed couples
customer_reviews.text: This is great. However a couple of things I didn’t think of before I purchased. It is easy to clean, however it is very cold to lay I’m so you want to purchase something to put on top. I bought the oval changing pad covers and it was a perfect fit. The second thing is if you have a left/right handed couple, then this might not work. Since it is slightly sloped I have it set up to lay the baby down with her head on the left, but my husband is left handed and wants her head on the right. Obviously not efficient to switch the pad back and forth between changes
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C. Grafton

customer_reviews.title: Great changing pad
customer_reviews.text: We really like this changing pad because it’s wipeable and doesn’t require any covers. It works great on top of our dresser! One thing i would note is that since there’s no absorbency (ie a changing pad cover), if my baby pees upwards during a change, it pools under his head where the changing pad sort of dips down! Also I usually put a prefold cloth diaper down under him when I change him. You could say this defeats the point of a coverless changing pad, but I still think it’s better than having covers because I already have tons of prefolds and this is just an additional use for them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G

customer_reviews.title: Necessity? No. Loving it? YES.
customer_reviews.text: Let's get down to it: -No stains after 2 weeks (wipe it each time) -Very easy to clean regardless of urine or blowouts Iincline allows any fluids to flownto the bottom so baby doesn't sit it in it -Our baby is almost 10 lbs and there is tons of room. We will use it for months. Loving it and glad we bought it. Shipper must ship out of their own warehouse because it'll take a week or so receieve which is a down side. Great product! Inventors should be proud.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and no laundry required
customer_reviews.text: This was one of our favorite purchases for our nursery. It’s easy to clean and spares you having to do laundry every time your baby pukes or pees or poops on your changing mat with one of those covers. It is expensive but we figured we are saving on water and laundry, by not having to wash a changing mat cover every 10 minutes, because our daughter soiled it. We simply use wipes to wipe it clean and get our child back in bed. My only complaint is the material is cold and my daughter is not a fan of it touching her bare skin.
customer_reviews.author: Mrtrick54

customer_reviews.title: Love this product would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, good size for dresser, soft, and love the safety belt feature. Cons: Most effective way to use this is without a sheet...so you can just wipe away the mess. That being said the material is kinda cold and normally makes her cry when we first lay her down. Only complaint, but don't know how you would fix and the pros are much better than the one con. We love this product and are probably going to buy as gift for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: AverageGuy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: 3 have three of these. One is two and a half years old, we got one for our daughter (3months) and the play room. They are easy to clean and to me seem way more sanitary then other padded changing pads. It is a bit cold so we do use a blanket on the upper portion (during the winter) so it’s not as shocking after a bath or when doing a full clothes change.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Oily residue, wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of this changer but I'm concerned that it's got some kind of weird residue on it. It feels oily to the touch. I ordered aqua and the box shows a pretty aqua changer but it's a very masculine blue and not at all what I was hoping for. Another reviewer had the same issues as me so maybe try a different color and be prepared to clean it thoroughly when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: J. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to justify pulling the trigger on this but I am glad we did. My husband and I find the Keekaroo extremely easy to clean, should there be a mess and the baby seems comfortable on it while we change him. Absolutely would buy again, considering how many times my son has peed WHILE I'm changing him and got it everywhere. I can't imagine having to unzip a cover each time it happened with any other changing pad!
customer_reviews.author: Another Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Love this changer!
customer_reviews.text: This changer is perfect for our nursery room. It fits with our grey/white/pink color scheme, and the best part is that we can wipe it down every day - no need to do laundry when it gets dirty!!! It's not as comfortable as the changers with cloth covers, but I'd rather be able to clean it more easily. We just put a soft cloth where she rests her head and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: This is a very practical changing pad. Easy to clean and ergonomic. My only issue with it is the strong plastic smell. We have had it for a month and it still smells like off gassing plastic. I keep the window cracked to get fresh air and have cleaned the Peanut dozens of times but it still has that Plastic odor. I put a towel down and try not to let the babies skin touch it in case it is toxic. They do say it is PVC, BPA free but it sure doesn't smell like it.
customer_reviews.author: STBLACK

customer_reviews.title: Cleanest Pad I owned!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pad after I started an in home daycare and gave birth to our fourth child. This pad was SOO easy to keep clean, even after poop smears got on it. Unlike the vinyl pads, the poop smear stain didn't get into the grooves of the pad, just wiped right off. Changing 10-12 diapers a day for a few years this pad stood up to the abuse and was still in pristine condition when I passed it on to our church nursery. Would I purchase this pad again? You bet your wallet I would! It was well worth every cent I paid for it!
customer_reviews.author: SMarquez

customer_reviews.title: LOVE ❤️ 💖 Our Peanut!
customer_reviews.text: We love our peanut so much! Not only is it more aesthetically pleasing to look at than the generic white cushion style, it is safer. Yes it comes with a strap, but we have not had to use it quite yet. The sides are high enough that our baby can't roll over them. It is easy to clean messes when they happen, and it doesn't skid around on the dresser where we have it! It is soft enough and firm enough and keeps its shape! We have recommended this product to others and they are getting them too.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Martin

customer_reviews.title: The best baby product we own
customer_reviews.text: My daughter peed all over this second day we had it. With the old changer, that would have meant trying to keep her from kicking her feet into the puddle, moving her somewhere else to finish the diaper change, taking the thing apart ant doing a load of laundry. With this changer, I just wiped it down and we were good to go. Also, we were worried that the surface would be cold on her skin, but it's not. BEST CHANGER EVER! So glad it finally came back in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Vanilla Color Stained Pink
customer_reviews.text: I was willing to pay more for this changing pad in hopes that it was quality and would last me for multiple kids! 4 months in, it developed this pink stain all over it. I never write bad reviews but I am so disappointed! Hoping keekaroo will send a replacement to make it right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Imperfect
customer_reviews.text: Really excited to get this as many friends highly recommend the keekaroo peanut. After getting the keekaroo unboxed, we noticed that the base foam (under the gray protective outer shell) has a silver dollar sized hole / deep depression on the left ledge. It seems like a manufacturing moulding defect. I normally would not care, but for the price, I feel like this product should arrive in mint condition.
customer_reviews.author: Seth C.

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this five stars as a changing pad if not for the price. I purchased this and actually really love it for how easy it is to clean. I later purchased the Hatch Baby Grow Smart Changing Pad and Scale, because I needed a home baby scale... which is about the same price as the Peanut Changer but duals as a changing pad/scale. The cost on this pad is ridiculous, should be under $50.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Oily and weird smell
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this for the easy usability, unfortunately I ordered 2. The first came oily and appeared dirty. The 2nd also came oily and with a strange chemical smell. We sent both back and went organic with the naturepedic changing pad. Keekaroo did fit very nicely on top of the pre-designed changing area on top of the baby dresser, just wish the material wasn't so odd and oily. I did not want my baby laying on this.
customer_reviews.author: Arash N Attar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We are huge fans of the Keekaroo changing pad. This is the second one that we got because we loved our other one so much. First it allows us to put the changing pad on a dresser. It has a great adhesive adn a safety strap. The best thing is how easy this is to clean. It takes no time to disenfect and there is no covers to purchase and wash if something gets on them.
customer_reviews.author: Hymn.Life

customer_reviews.title: Might be the best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking of using a changing pad with a cover - DON'T. This thing is seriously the best. Our little boy loves to poop and pee as soon as his diaper is removed, and if we had something absorbent under him it would have been toast on day one. This looks plasticky and hard but don't be deceived, it is super soft and squishy and since it's not absorbent it's ridiculously easy to clean up. It's expensive, but totally worth the cost IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Vivona

customer_reviews.title: Permanent stains
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of this and the fact that you could wipe it clean. But it stained within weeks of using it. It now looks like it has a permanent poop stain on it even though we never left a mess on it and always immediately cleaned it. Would NOT recommend. Not worth the money and wish I wouldn’t have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Love this multi-use peanut changer!
customer_reviews.text: I love the portability of this item! I use it on my kitchen table for diaper changes. Also, in those first few weeks when you’re sponge bathing baby it works perfectly on the bathroom floor as a comfortable, secure space to wash baby. It’s very easy to wipe clean. My only negative is that when it arrived it had a sort of greasy film to it. I washed it twice with mild dish soap and it seems to be gone for the most part. And when diapering, I use a receiving blanket on top to keep baby warm.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kittok

customer_reviews.title: But I love it. Wipes clean so easily no worrying about ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely pricy and a splurge when compared to the basic changing pad. But I love it. Wipes clean so easily no worrying about covers or washing them. Fits perfect in/on my changing table. 4 stars bc the price makes it almost not worth it .. you can always leave the basic pad without covers...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: We started out with a traditional foam changing pad, but after our child peed and pooped on it during changes we noticed that it was soiled to the point where if you pressed on the pad with your hand "poop soup" would seep up out of the pad. We replaced our foam pad with the Keekaroo Peanut, and it is GREAT! It's angled, so if your child does pee during changes it tracks down toward the feet and not up toward the head. Easy to wipe clean. I also like that the sides curve upward, so it somewhat contains baby wiggles during changing. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: AGM

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about purchasing a changer with this price tag, but I'm so glad I did. If you're on the fence about this or one of the more common changing pads with the cloth covers, keep in mind it WILL get diaper contents on it. Sometimes more than once a day if it just happens to be one of those days. And this is so easy to wipe down with a disinfectant wipe and go on. No need to have multiple changing pad covers and extra laundry to do. Anything you can make easier with a newborn, I consider that worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Smith

customer_reviews.title: No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: The last thing I need right now is more laundry, so it's awesome just being able to wipe this thing down in the event of a blowout. We haven't had any issues that other reviewers have complained about. It's been sitting on our dresser (painted white wood) for 3 months now and hasn't damaged the wood or paint. Baby seems to like it just fine. Pee tends to run down towards the foot end of the pad, so it doesn't get all over her.
customer_reviews.author: E. Yost

customer_reviews.title: You will want this...!
customer_reviews.text: A must product for any first-time parent. In just one week we have had multiple explosive poop/pee episodes, that would have created a giant mess in our nursery if it weren't for this item. Easy to clean (use warm water and soap -- not any harsh cleaning wipes that can cause staining), and saves you the hassle of swapping changing sheets every day. Highly recommend~!
customer_reviews.author: Ajay &.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer ❤
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this product! Perfect for diaper changes! Fits very well on top of the dresser and doesn't slide or move around. It does get cold, so I recommend laying a receiving blanket or cloth over the top (Also beneficial to do so in the case of a pee pee accident, it will absorb most of the mess so you don't have to wipe down the keekaroo with more than an antibacterial wipe). This product is sturdy, safe, and I feel that it will be used for generations to come! Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen S.

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product enough! It is durable but soft and cushy for my daughter. Easy to wipe up all diaper messes and doesn't move around on top of the dresser. It is also not super heavy so we bring it into the bathroom to lay her towel on to wrap her after bath time instead of just leaving the towel on the hard counter.
customer_reviews.author: mgrod

customer_reviews.title: Definitely on the expensive side when compared to other changing ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely on the expensive side when compared to other changing pads, however does not require that I wash/change a cover. Instead I can simply wipe down. My only complaint, brown discoloration from cleaning after about 2 days of use.
customer_reviews.author: finbob

customer_reviews.title: Nice changing pad
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy mat that is waterproof and easy to wipe clean. It’s nice if you want to use water to squirt off baby’s bottom rather than wipe it. It has been very useful for us although it can be a little cold on baby at first. Also, I really like it, but I am still not sure it’s worth the $125-ish. It was a gift to me so I am glad to have it but probably wouldn’t have paid that much to buy it for myself.
customer_reviews.author: MMP

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: As parents of a boy who likes to pee the minute his diaper is off, this has been a lifesaver. It's so easy to wipe down. And I'm not sure what it is, but our little guy stops crying the minute he is on his peanut. It's one of my top 5 baby items and worth the splurge.
customer_reviews.author: Deena B.

customer_reviews.title: This is great. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 5 star for absorbency because it doesn’t absorb anything. This has been awesome. My only issue is that the strap that you can secure to your changing table doesn’t secure to the Keekaroo itself, so it ends up moving around. I just used some 3M adhesive to solve that and it’s been secure since.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: Great and saves on extra laundry from traditional changing pade
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the traditional changing mattress pad/cover. Anytime our son has an accident on this it's just a wipe clean effort, no need for extra laundry and having to change the mattress pad/cover each time... Ain't nobody got time for all that. I haven't experienced the issues noted by others regarding the color fading and I've been wiping this clean at least 3-4 times per week.
customer_reviews.author: onefastricerocket

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now
customer_reviews.text: My husband gave me so much slack for spending so much money on a changing table. After the first week our son was born, we both agreed this was worth every penny. It’s super soft for the baby, and it really doesn’t absorb any pee. It’s really good with stains as well. I’ll have one for each child!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite baby products! I was skeptical at first because of the cost, but it’s so worth it! It’s incredibly easy to clean - Poop and pee wipes right up with a diaper wipe. My baby loves laying on it - She’ll lay there for ten minutes after her diaper change :) it definitely smelled when I first got it but I aired it out and it’s totally fine now. Love that baby cannot roll off (at least for now!)
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Super highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's pricey, but soooooo worth it. So so easy to clean. Many-a projectile pee has been cleaned up so quickly hahaha! When my baby was super tiny, we put a swaddle down - he cried because the Keekaroo was cold on his tiny body - but that only lasted a few weeks. Now we use it as is and it's great. Again, highly recommend. Save yourself the laundry, for reals.
customer_reviews.author: srkhart

customer_reviews.title: Germophobe friendly
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE - 21 months later: Our family is even more in love with this changing pad. It has worn beautifully and has been aggressively used every single day. Enough for me to find my review and update it :) I love love love this changer. It’s super easy to clean and disinfect as opposed to washing the changing sheet numerous times and having several backups. I use disposable changing liners if I’m dealing with a blowout to keep things contained but that’s me being super extra.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: We were a little hesitant this would be worth the price but are so glad we went for it! It is so easy to clean and looks great in the nursery. It is the perfect size to fit on top of the dresser and doesn't slide around. This is now my "must have" recommendation to any expecting mother.
customer_reviews.author: Adele Byrns

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to hate this, but I love it
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I thought what's the big deal? But it is saving me on laundry (although I still put liners down b/c it's kind of cold and firm for a newborn). Love giving my baby sponge baths on this as well, and the fact that it stays put and I don't have to pay for one of those dresser inserts to wedge it in (or nail it to the back of the dresser).
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: I wish I knew about this sooner
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommended this when our regular changing table pad ripped (and this was a really expensive one so I was annoyed). This is brilliant. No more washing covers and then putting them on only to have them immediately soiled. You just wipe this down and you're done. It's also really soft and durable. Can't recommend enough....save yourself the hassle of washing changing pad covers and get this....
customer_reviews.author: Tot Tots

customer_reviews.title: Must have item
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our keekaroo changing pad. It’s become one of our “must have” baby items and biggest recommendation to any friends who are pregnant. It is so easy to clean up those little, “accident while changing” mishaps. I cannot imagine having to change a pad cover every time our little one decided to pee mid-diaper change. With the keekaroo, you just wipe it off and you’re good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Heise

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! This changing pad is great. This has saved me from so many late night bathes, as my daughter loves to go to the bathroom the second you take off her diaper. All liquids run down to the bottom away from baby. It is super easy to clean up messes and is very heavy duty. My only complaint is that is gets a little cold, so we just put down a receiving blanket for nighttime changes to avoid shocking her awake.
customer_reviews.author: Madam Engineer

customer_reviews.title: A must have, perfectly designed
customer_reviews.text: The single most life-enhancing item my wife and I have ever purchased or used for our newborn. I cannot imagine using any other pad. It is the perfect weight, size, and texture. It doesn't get too cold, it is soft enough for baby's skin, it is super easy to wipe down, it is large enough to catch anything that spurts out during changing, and it is heavy enough that I never worry about it moving. I cannot imagine trying to change diapers on any other material, or on a changer that is any smaller. Truly perfectly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Etteilla

customer_reviews.title: Completely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I felt a little silly spending the extra money on this changing pad compared to the traditional fabric covered kind. But it quickly proved its value!!!! My baby frequently pees while I'm changing her diaper and with this changing pad it's no big deal, no extra laundry, no changing the cover. I keep a glass spray bottle nearby in the nursery of 50/50 water and white vinegar to spray it down and use baby's cloth wipes (we cloth diaper) to clean up any messes. Love this stupid thing. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This changing pad is seriously amazing. It not only looks good but it does it’s job perfectly. It’s worth the hefty price tag in my opinion. It’s such good quality that I know it’ll last through multiple kids. It’s soft and not too firm. It’s so easy to clean. Having a boy means they pee everywhere when you change their diaper. We have even experienced a poopsplosion or two and this thing wipes down so easy. You don’t have to worry about it staining. You don’t have to worry about doing laundry for a bunch of changing pad covers. It’s just so good
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Maples

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect changing cushion. Very soft yet sturdy and comfortable for the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Marnise Worthem

customer_reviews.title: Baby must have!
customer_reviews.text: While having a newborn, I have been so grateful that we purchased the peanut changer! It would never fail that my little one would urinate before I could get the diaper under her bottom. The peanut changer can be easily cleaned up and I don’t have to worry about it having to dry out like a foam changing pad. It has been very helpful! We recommend it to any expecting parent!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Wells

customer_reviews.title: Best baby buy, easy peasy clean-up
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this changing pad, it's definitely one of the best baby buys we made. This portable pad with a non-slip surface can be put on anywhere in the house and provides a great cushion and support for the baby. What's most important is that it is very easy to clean (just wipe it down and use some disinfectant) which makes it perfect for our baby since she loves to do her business once her diaper is off. No need for pad liners and exra laundry, the pad itself is soft enough and baby does not get cold during diaper changes. Give it a try, it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Worth it 100%
customer_reviews.text: Cannot recommend enough. Compare to a simple pad that won't collect poop and pee the same, it is SO easy to clean. No more rubby poop at 3am on a fabric pad. Pricey, but every time you'll need it you'll thank yourself. Also, the strap works well: i just give him the strap and he is occupied enough not to try to escape :)
customer_reviews.author: ronan carrein

customer_reviews.title: Best quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I have bought, I use both of them I have a home day care and we have to disinfect after every diaper change. I was replacing after about a month until I found this changing pad. I find it to be the most comfortable and easy to clean for germ control. this is expensive but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Susu

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This product came highly recommended by some friends while I was pregnant. I do love the convenience of being able to wipe the Keekaroo so easily after messy diaper changes. Less laundry is a great thing as a new parent. However, my little one is only 2.5 months old and I am already noticing some discoloration on our gray model - not sure how to remove it, but I'm a bit disappointed as I had hoped this product would last for several years with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This has been so handy with a newborn. She likes to pee and poop during changes and this collects it and allows us to clean easily. No need to wash soiled changing pad covers. Our baby doesn’t like her naked skin coming in contact with the material, so we do lay a muslin down on the top half when changing her. It always holds her well when she is wiggling around. This is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for new parents
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people thought I was insane for paying this much for a changing pad, but you'll be thanking yourself for splurging when your baby has an open air accident all over it at 4am and you can wipe it up in a matter of seconds. I honestly don't know why they don't make all changing pads this way. I would never buy the other kind with liners and sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration on Grey Changer Right Out of Box
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive my Keekaroo changer today, however, the product had a dark stain and/or discoloration on one part of the changer straight out of the box. I was very disappointed that given the price point, the changer wasn’t in perfect condition colorwise.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Our little one has had a few surprises for us in the middle of changing her, so the keekaroo has been a great investment. We don't have to worry about changing out her changing pad on top of everything else! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Keekaroo
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, minimalistic. Love this for our baby’s changing space! Haven’t used yet, as baby is due in a couple weeks- will update of stains easily. Hoping not, as the reviews have been mixed for this! Crossing my fingers it’s as good as we’re hoping!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It is worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I was sooooooo hesitant to buy this product because of the cost. I thought it was crazy but after my baby having many accidents on the changing table and all I have to do is effortlessly wipe it up...SO worth it. Just buy it already if the only thing stopping you is the cost. It will be worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: austin w.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged much to my disappointment. The circular vent was not attached, interior foam visible, and knicks and scratches to the pad. I am disappointed to have to go to the trouble of returning this item (especially while being pregnant) just to get a refund. I would have expected better quality control for such a high end item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The easiest cleanup
customer_reviews.text: A lifesaver for apartment-dwellers who do not have washer-dryer. We were wiping this thing down multiple times a day with our newborn who would relieve himself during diaper changes. I could not imagine using a changing pad that required cloth covers. We would have been doing laundry every day. Also great for allowing your little one some diaper-free time in a waterproof environment. I also use it when I give my baby a sponge bath. Our baby loves to lay in it, as it is somewhat soft and doesn't get cold.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia K

customer_reviews.title: Cold and hard surface
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product but my 3 month old hasn’t liked the feel of it since he was born. It’s cold to the touch and even when it’s 100 degrees outside it’s cold and it makes my baby scream and cry. It’s not as soft as I thought it would be so I’m extra gentle when placing him on it even though we even cover it with a blanket to make it softer. I wish I had saved the money and purchased a standard changing pad because they’re softer and the surface won’t make my baby cold.
customer_reviews.author: Nori

customer_reviews.title: The Only Diaper Pad You Should Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. It makes accidents during diaper changes a non-issue and it's definitely large enough to continue using as my baby grows. The incline at the bottom half means messes collect at the bottom away from my baby potentially avoiding an outfit change! Less things to throw in the hamper!
customer_reviews.author: City Mom

customer_reviews.title: this is so much better. It's soft provides great support and is easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what I'd do with a standard changing pad, this is so much better. It's soft provides great support and is easy to clean. We've had a few times where waste got on the changing pad, it's easy to wipe or wash and doesn't require a cover. It also looks really nice in the nursery, it's pricey but totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moses

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We really debated on this as it seems so expensive for a changing pad. Worth every penny. Baby absolutely loves hanging out on it which makes diaper changes so much easier. Definitely on our must have list.
customer_reviews.author: lqapinhead

customer_reviews.title: Perfect changing pad
customer_reviews.text: I love this changing pad. It wipes clean so easily, it can be cleaned after every change so it’s always fresh. Another great thing is you don’t need to buy changing pad covers or worry about having to wash them. The sides are very high and can’t be squished down easily, reducing the fear of a rolling Baby falling. Of course you still need to be careful, but babies get so squirmy and it adds price of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: If you have a boy, buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a MUST have for a newborn baby. Especially for boys. My husband won’t even use our other changer because this one makes it easy to clean up after the baby. Wish it was a tad softer, but it’s worth every single penny. Should have bought two instead of our other changer. Only thing I can see that might be bad is If you live in colder weather it could be cold for your newborn.
customer_reviews.author: Amy frame

customer_reviews.title: Great product but cold
customer_reviews.text: I love this changer. Great looks, easy to install. What I like the most is that it’s very easy to clean (no need to wash covers). In general is a great product but my son cries everytime I put him on it because it is cold. I started using kind of a napkin on it so he would not cry when in contact with the cold surface
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: For the parent that doesn’t want a soaking wet changing pad...
customer_reviews.text: We’ve only had our baby for 5 days now and we already know this is a winning product. Originally when I heard about this and saw the price I thought never...but to buy a pillow like changing pad plus some inevitable covers for it the price of that started to add up. My husband has said multiple times already he’s glad we’ve gotten this because when it gets dirty you just wipe it clean. I would recommend this to any parent (that knows they will always use this to change their baby and not bed or floor etc.)
customer_reviews.author: DeeAnn Alcorn

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but great
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I were loath to add yet one more thing that would need laundering, so decided to try this out. We just love it - it's comfortable, and SO EASY to clean if it gets messy during a diaper change. The only caveats are that it can be pretty cold (doesn't bother my son now at 19 months, but did when he was younger), and the edges take up some space - so there's less room for my tall son to fit on the dresser top. But at this point, his feet are well beyond the bottom, and it's not really a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Franz Family

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am SO glad we invested in the Keekaroo Peanut instead of a regular change table setup. It is SO versatile. My husband has remarked every day about how the Peanut is the best thing we've bought for our baby and would recommend it to everyone! Our newborn sleeps in her room during the day and in her bassinet in our room at night, and the Peanut makes it a cinch to move her changing set up between rooms. We use it with a towel laid on top of it for sponge baths. Blowouts are no big deal with no messy sheets to deal with as the Keekaroo Peanut wipes clean! We love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: GabbyFraser

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. We put it on the vanity in our bathroom. Doesn't slip or slide and my daughter can look at herself in the mirror. Very comfortable as well. I also plan to throw this in a suitcase during our next family vacation. Worth the money, wish we had got it the first round with our son.
customer_reviews.author: book junkie

customer_reviews.title: they’re amazing, I’m expecting and I’m a preschool teacher also
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used mine yet but I ordered this one cuz’ I used to work on a daycare that they have this ones , they’re amazing , I’m expecting and I’m a preschool teacher also , so I was looking for something amazing for my baby stylish and practical... easy to wipe off to clean maintain and your baby is gonna be safe , it has a good size too.
customer_reviews.author: vknuth

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I was concerned the vanilla wouldn’t match my white nursery but it looks great . It’s so squishy and comfy and fits perfect on top of any dresser .
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this except that it doesn’t fit easily on the pottery barn kids dresser changing table topper. We had to trim an edge off. But outside of that we are obsessed. It’s so easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: J.Bird

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using our changing pad for almost 5 months and love it. It’s in our master bathroom and very easy to clean. Since it’s next to the sink, it’s convenient for rinsing/soaping our baby’s bottom etc. Lastly, Baby O loves laying on it...he often smiles and giggles while staring at the mirror or caregiver. This pad has worked wonders for fussy times! Tip: If price is an issue, use your Amazon baby registry discount like we did.
customer_reviews.author: smilemore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent investment!
customer_reviews.text: We were hesitant to purchase such an expensive changing pad, but I am so glad we did. This is great for so much: sponge baths, tummy time, giving medicine, and of course, changing diapers and clothes. This is the first thing we recommend to all of our friends who are expecting. You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: ... price and I wasn't sure how the baby would like it- would he think it's too cold or too ...
customer_reviews.text: I was initially skeptical about buying this product because of the price and I wasn't sure how the baby would like it- would he think it's too cold or too hard? However, after he peed/pooped on the changer the first couple of times I knew I had made the right choice. This certainly beats washing changing pad covers, and baby is not bothered by the temperature/texture, etc. We simply wipe away the mess. Even though it was $98.00, it sure beats doing loads of laundry, especially in the middle of the night. I will say the Vanilla is not a white color, but more of a light grey, but it still looks nice and complements a white dresser well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. Good quality. Just wipe clean. It’s cushiony and not hard at all , baby loves it. Matches my baby nursery decor too!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Less Mess, Less Stress!!!  Best Baby Purchase Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th Peanut changer we've purchased; one for ourselves and 3 others for friends and family's baby showers. It's by far the best baby item I've gotten and recommend it strongly over the traditional diaper changing pad. No covers, no washing machine loads, just keep a Lysol wipes container nearby it's clean in seconds. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: My FAVORITE baby product
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I reflect often on how this is our FAVORITE product for our 1 month + old. Loving a changing pad that much might seem silly, but this thing is a lifesaver. It's a good size and SO EASY TO CLEAN AND SANITIZE! I can't imagine having to change a regular changing pad every time my daughter gets a mess on it, which sometimes is once a day. I seriously love this thing. I tell everyone who asks that it is worth every penny! Love the vanilla color.
customer_reviews.author: The Calming Corner

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: I was not aware of this changing pad when I had my child. When I saw it on my friend’s registry, I knew it was a must have item. With the amount of diaper changes you do, this is well worth the price. Love the convenience of wiping clean vs machine washing and drying a cloth cover.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a newborn
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the most recommended items from our friends who had kids and for good reason: it is soft and incredibly easy to clean when your newborn inevitably pees and or poops while being changed. We just wipe it down with a wet wipe and wash it after bath time with soap once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great especially for baby boys
customer_reviews.text: With a baby boy, the keekaroo peanut is a must have for me. No need to wash changing pad covers or protectors because my son has peed on them. Baby boys are known for making it stream when they're naked! My only issue with it is after wiping it down with a Lysol spray, there was some discoloration for almost $100 I didn't expect that kind of cosmetic issue
customer_reviews.author: Raquintyre

customer_reviews.title: Your friend
customer_reviews.text: We use it, our friends use it, we gift it to new parents. It's a must, can't imagine life before it ... imagine changing and washing your changing pad every time your baby soils it ... so redundant, so useless.
customer_reviews.author: CocoD

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had these for my first child! Stylish and seems comfortable. I haven’t put the straps on and it looks perfect! A little pricey but it seems like it will last a long time. And no pad covers to wash!
customer_reviews.author: Momma4

customer_reviews.title: Great but I’d like a cover for it to add warmth.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Great shape and secure. My only negative is that I wish it came with a cover. It’s cold so I always put muslin on top / underneath my baby, when using it
customer_reviews.author: Debs Malia

customer_reviews.title: Not essential
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in my registry, haven’t used it that much. Hoping to use it eventually more frequently. My son is 4 months now.
customer_reviews.author: shirin

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for baby!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best purchase for any nursery! Saves you from doing tons of laundry and wipes down easily. Our newborn has put it to good use with blowouts and open air accidents and this changing table has been amazing! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KIR86

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best purchase we made for our son. As first time parents we never imagined how many times our newborn son was going to pee or poop during diaper changes. This changing pad is easy to wipe down especially during those late night diaper changes when all you want to do is go back to bed. I can’t imagine having to wash cloth covers for a traditional changing pad over and over. This item is a must!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sanudo

customer_reviews.title: Boy mom's best friend!
customer_reviews.text: My newborn son has had “open air accidents” during many of his diaper changes - which means that the peanut gets peed on about 6 times a day right now. Each time, it just cleans right up with a paper towel and Lysol wipe. I cannot even imagine dealing with a cloth covering that has to be removed and washed. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Candice D.

product_meta.title: Keekaroo Peanut Changer, Grey, One Size
product_meta.description: Color:GreyPeanut Changer from Keekaroo is the clean and safe way diaper changing pad to change your ‘little peanut’. Impermeable to fluids, the soft-to-the-touch Keekaroo Peanut Changer needs no additional sheets or pads commonly required for other diaper changing pads. The solid surface wipes clean and limits the chance for bacterial growth. Made from our unique soft and cushy material that was designed and tested for hospital use, the Keekaroo Peanut Changer provides a clean, safe and comfortable diaper changer surface for diaper changes.
feature_bullets: Easy to Clean - Solid surface wipes down easily and limits bacteria growth
Protective Layer - Surface allows for immediate cleaning
Water Resistant - Fluids cannot penetrate into the pad, stopping mold or deterioration
Soft to the Touch - Soft, comfortable surface makes for great napping spot. Non-Toxic
BPA-, PVC-, latex-, and phthalate-free ; Weight Capacity : 30 lb.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,028 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
